prompt: When you lead, what feels right at your core?

options.A: Set the line so others can move with you.
options.B: Break the line so movement starts again.

options.A: Language I declare so work is clear.
options.B: Material I bend to open the path.

prompt: Power, in your body, feels like…

options.A: Calm authority that others align to.
options.B: A spark that flips the room into motion.

prompt: What pulls you more when you move?

options.A: The end picture that calls from the future.
options.B: The next step that keeps the route clean.

options.A: Timing the reveal when the arc is ready.
options.B: Pacing the work so it finishes on time.

options.A: The bold line that fits the long story.
options.B: The simple line that lands a result now.

options.A: Keep the field fair so power is balanced.
options.B: Keep people safe so harm does not land.

options.A: Redraw the rule so all play by it.
options.B: Shield the person most at risk.

options.A: Shared limits that make things fair.
options.B: Knowing the vulnerable are protected.

prompt: Truth, to you, shows up first as…

options.A: A live signal I can test in the wild.
options.B: A clear frame I can build and check.

options.A: Patterns emerge from real examples.
options.B: Definitions lock and terms stay clean.

prompt: Your core move with confusion is…

options.A: Ask for the one signal that matters.
options.B: Draw the structure so parts fit right.

prompt: How do you make change real?

options.A: Shine a light so people see and move.
options.B: Bridge sides so people align and move.

options.A: Public signal that carries far.
options.B: Quiet deals that unlock doors.

prompt: What feels more honest to you?

options.A: Stand up and show the win.
options.B: Line up the room, then share the win.

prompt: Care, in your body, is mostly…

options.A: Being there with you through the hard part.
options.B: Doing the thing so your load is lighter.

prompt: What proves love to you more?

options.A: We face it side by side.
options.B: I handle it so you can rest.

options.A: Staying close in the storm.
options.B: Taking care of the needs.

options.A: Ignite motion and cut the drag.
options.B: Keep quality and land one clean piece.

prompt: What do you trust more when it’s tight?

options.A: Start the chain and push it forward.
options.B: Craft the standard others can copy.

options.A: Making the first move that changes the field.
options.B: Making the thing so well it holds up.
